localString.value: Welcome, traveller, to the Land of Nordock! What would you like to know?
What subrace would you like to know more about?
Simply create a character with the race of Halfling, and put Strong in your subrace field. Strongheart Halfling Traits: +1 STR -1 universal saving throw
Simply create a character with the race of Halfling, and put Ghost in your subrace field. Ghostwise Halfling Traits: -1 universal saving throw
Simply create a character with the race of Half-Elf, and put Drow in your subrace field. Half-drow Traits: Darkvision

Simply create a character with the race of Gnome, and put Deep in your subrace field. Deep Gnomes Traits: +2 DEX, +2WIS, -2 CON, -4 CHA Spell-like Ability - blindness/deafness 1/day Stonecunning - +2 Hide & Search while underground Spell Resistance of 11 + character level +4 dodge AC -4 dodge AC vs giants +2 universal saving throw Darkvision +2 Hide ECL: +3

Simply create a character with the race Elf. Click the Subrace button and type Drow...you must capitalize the D. Be warned, it's harder to play a Drow. You have your own start area and many NPCs do not like you. Also, playing a Drow does not give you a license to hassle or grief other players. People who ruin the gaming experience of others, regardless of their character's race,will be CD-key banned. Drow Traits: +2 INT, +2 CHA Spell-like Ability - darkness 1/day Light Sensitivity: Drow suffer a -1 penalty to attack rolls, saves, and checks in bright light or within the radius of a light spell. Spell Resistance of 11 + character level +2 Will save against spells +2 Will save against mind-spells Darkvision Drow are blinded for 6 seconds when coming into bright light. Favored Class - Cleric ECL: +2
Simply create a character with the race of Elf, and put Wood in your subrace field. Wood Elves Traits: +2 STR, -2 INT, -2 CHA Favored Class - Ranger
Simply create a character with the race of Elf, and put Wild in your subrace field. Wild Elves Traits: +2 CON, -2 INT Favored Class - Sorcerer
Simply create a character with the race of Elf, and put Sun in your subrace field. Sun Elves Traits: +2 INT, -2 DEX

Simply create a character with the race of Dwarf, and put Duergar in your subrace field. Then be sure to customize your character to have gray skin,a nd either black, white or gray hair. The Duergar diety is Laduguer, so use that also. DuergarTraits: -2 CHA Immune to Paralysis Immune to Poison +4 Move Silently +1 Listen & Spot Spell-like Ability - invisibility 1/day Light Sensitivity: Duergar suffer a -2 penalty to attack rolls, saves, and checks in bright light or within the radius of a light spell. ECL: +2
Simply create a character with the race of Dwarf, and put Gold in your subrace field. Gold Dwarf Traits: +2 CHA, -2 DEX -1 attack vs orcs -1 attack vs goblinoids +1 attack vs aberrations

We use a modified version of Hardcore Death. If you are killed, you go to Fugue. In the Fugue Plane, you can talk to the Guardian to respawn. If you do this, you lose 10% of your XP. Raise Dead or Ressurection can be cast on the corpse to bring a player back to life. A level 17 or higher player cleric can use Balm of True Ressurection...this allows you to be raised with less XP loss (3%). Also, the priests in the Temple can perform True Rez. In both cases, no body is needed. (talk to the NPC Priest to request a True Rez for anyone currently in Fugue). Be warned he will take your money BEFORE contacting the afterlife. Make sure your friend is really there.

Yes. We are using the Hard Core rest rules. You may rest once every 6 hours. You also need food to rest. You can buy food or skin animals and cook their meat on a campfire to make food. Skin animals with a skinning knife, available at some merchants. Make a campfire by using a flask of oil on the ground. Certain inns allow you to bypass these rules, if you buy a key. One game hour is 2 minutes of real time.

Richterm (who goes by Marc in the real world) has played D&D off and on since 1979 or so. He's played computer games just as long. He's married with 3 daughters and a son on the way (woot!) He works as a computer guy at Merck and Co. in New Jersey. He started work on Nordock shortly after NWN launched...the first server went up in July of 2002. He'd probably thank me here for reminding you that this server is based on his Nordock public release and the official nordock.net group offer no support for this server at all. Playzen.net on the other hand has a large online community of helpful people willing to help.
This world started as a server test and grew from there. There are half a dozen "official servers" hosted under the Richterm's Retreat name, but this is a custom version used for the playzen servers.

The City of Benzor and the merchant shops inside the city are safe zones. All other zones in the game (including other towns and cities) are, at this time, full PVP - taking into account the rules in your journal of course (press 'J' to bring it up). This allows visitors a chance to settle in without being attacked. Also, the Respawn point for all is in Beznor, so this prevents "respawn camping".

Well, first and foremost, you may see Galdor the Gold. He's an ancient gold dragon that considers Benzor one of his homes. We're all rather fond of him. There are boats that you can take to other cities or you can follow the roads where they may lead.

In Benzor, to the west and a bit north, you'll find Ashal and his wagon. Also west is Malk's magic shop, at the base of his tower. More towards the middle of the city is the Temple of Life, who sell other items. Right south of it is Sadusky's Supplies, who cater to adventurers. Finally, the Salty Dog Tavern is east and a bit south towards the docks and has a fine selection of spirits.
Then your merchants will be in the Valley of Darkness (Dorn) and Loknar, the closest city to the surface.

Several things. First of all, there are static encounters that will respawn. Second, if DMs are on, they may start running an adventure for you, with dynamic quests and critters and NPCs. Third, the world is full PVP, if that's your thing. Remember to follow the rules in your journal by pressing 'J' though. You can relax in the Salty Dog with friends and chat it up. There is a robust trade skill system, allowing you to become a master weapnosmith or jewerlcrafter, among other things. Finally, you can just run around and explore if you wish.
I have read the rules in my journal. Send me in!
I understand I can play a subrace...how?
What are the server rules for death?
I understand there are special rules for resting?
Is there Player Versus Player (PVP) fighting?
What is there to do here?
